remarks: A complex number ` A ` that is not real, has a distance from the reals that is strictly larger than ` 0 ` .  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
statement:
dstregt0.1 $e |- ( ph -> A e. ( CC \ RR ) ) $.
dstregt0 $p |- ( ph -> E. x e. RR+ A. y e. RR x < ( abs ` ( A - y ) ) ) $.
$d A x y $.
$d ph y $.
